$GOOGL enters the AI economy with three advantages OpenAI doesn‚Äôt have:

1. Global distribution surfaces (Search, YouTube, Android, Gmail)
2. The world‚Äôs most efficient ad stack

That means AI usage for Google is margin-accretive by default and not something that needs to be figured out later.

BlueBird 6 was the moment $ASTS shifted from a long-running thesis to measurable execution by putting its first true commercial-scale, cell-tower-in-space satellite into orbit.

At 2,400 square feet, the size matters because if you want a normal phone in your pocket to talk to a satellite without a new antenna then you either fly closer or build a far larger, more powerful array so the satellite can ‚Äúhear‚Äù & ‚Äútalk back‚Äù the way a cell tower does. BlueBird 6 reflects AST‚Äôs choice to take the harder path by building a satellite that behaves like a tower in the sky.

Yesterday gave the market a much clearer line of sight into why this has the potential to become one of the defining infrastructure stories of the early space economy.

This is the power of compounding. 

At this size, every 10% move in $RKLB adds more than my entire original investment.
